other_tests.findings: SARS-CoV-2 positive results confirmed by rRT-PCR.
other_tests.changes_over_time: In 8 pairs (73%), â‰¥1 specimen tested positive or indeterminate, and in 3 pairs (27%) both tested negative. The initial respiratory specimens had relatively low Ct values, indicating higher levels of virus. Subsequent tests showed Ct values >35 after symptom resolution, indicating decreasing levels of virus.

other_tests.findings: SARS-CoV-2 positive results confirmed by rRT-PCR.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Ct values in the sputum specimen suggested higher levels of virus initially, showing a trend toward decreasing levels in subsequent tests.

other_tests.findings: All 35 nasopharyngeal and oropharyngeal specimens collected from high-risk contacts tested negative for SARS-CoV-2.
other_tests.changes_over_time: No new cases of SARS-CoV-2 infection were identified among contacts during the monitoring period.
